intro: Phellocarpus laxiflorus, commonly known as the Chinese mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to southern China. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
